titleStmt.title: Have-at a venture. The charms of love so powerful are, what mortal can withstand, or, who can say oppose they dare where Cupid bears command. This damsel quickly she did yield the youngsters skill to try, the twinkling archer won the field, and then she down did lye. Tune of, Hey boys up go we.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Wright, J. Clark, W. Thackery and T. Passenger.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "A countrey lad and bonny lass ..."
Item at A5:2[162] imperfect: trimmed, affecting imprint.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
